pullrequest.title: Fixes to compile gazebo in the ARM platform

content.raw:
Looks good.

One thought for follow-up: does anything here break ABI? If not we can also back port to release branches.
content.html:
Looks good.

One thought for follow-up: does anything here break ABI? If not we can also back port to release branches.

pullrequest.title: Fixes to compile gazebo in the ARM platform

content.raw:
The POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE target property is only available on CMake 2.8.9 and above; anyone on a distribution using an older release in the 2.8 series (e.g. Ubuntu 12.04 with CMake 2.8.7) would probably get an error during CMake configuration.  As a result, the minimum version macro in the main CMakeLists.txt should be changed to say 2.8.9 instead of 2.8, or we need to find a better way to add -fPIC to the two static libs.  

The advantage of the POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE property is that it does the Right Thing on all platforms, whereas you'd need to be more careful just adding the -fPIC CFLAG to static library targets if for example Gazebo ever supported Windows.  The other alternative is to just quit making qtpropertybrowser and gazebo_gui_terrain as separate static libraries, and just lump them both into gazebo_gui.so (since that's effectively what's happening anyway) and therefore be rid of the whole mixing static/shared library linkage altogether.
content.html:
The POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE target property is only available on CMake 2.8.9 and above; anyone on a distribution using an older release in the 2.8 series (e.g. Ubuntu 12.04 with CMake 2.8.7) would probably get an error during CMake configuration. As a result, the minimum version macro in the main CMakeLists.txt should be changed to say 2.8.9 instead of 2.8, or we need to find a better way to add -fPIC to the two static libs.

The advantage of the POSITION_INDEPENDENT_CODE property is that it does the Right Thing on all platforms, whereas you'd need to be more careful just adding the -fPIC CFLAG to static library targets if for example Gazebo ever supported Windows. The other alternative is to just quit making qtpropertybrowser and gazebo_gui_terrain as separate static libraries, and just lump them both into gazebo_gui.so (since that's effectively what's happening anyway) and therefore be rid of the whole mixing static/shared library linkage altogether.

pullrequest.title: Fixes to compile gazebo in the ARM platform

content.raw:
You are right, it was introduced in 2.8.9. However it is not failing on my precise machine (cmake 2.8.7).

What was weird to me is that ```-fPIC``` was present on the default precise compilation (even without this patch):

```
[100%] Building CXX object gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeFiles/gzqtpropertybrowser.dir/qrc_qtpropertybrowser.cxx.o
cd /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser && /usr/bin/c++   -DLIBBULLET_VERSION=2.82 -DQT_GUI_LIB -DQT_CORE_LIB -DQT_GUI_LIB -DQT_CORE_LIB -DQT_NO_DEBUG -DQT_NO_DEBUG -g -O2 -mfpmath=sse -msse -msse2  -Wall -Wextra -Wno-long-long -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wfloat-equal -Wshadow -Winit-self -Wswitch-default -Wmissing-include-dirs -pedantic  -g -O2 -mfpmath=sse -msse -msse2  -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/test/gtest/include -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/deps -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser -isystem /usr/include/OGRE/RTShaderSystem -isystem /usr/include/OGRE -isystem /usr/include/OGRE/Terrain -isystem /usr/include/OGRE/Paging -isystem /usr/local/include/sdformat-1.4 -I/usr/include/qt4 -I/usr/include/qt4/QtGui -I/usr/include/qt4/QtCore    -fPIC -o CMakeFiles/gzqtpropertybrowser.dir/qrc_qtpropertybrowser.cxx.o -c /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qrc_qtpropertybrowser.cxx
Linking CXX static library libgzqtpropertybrowser.a
```

After some research, I found that it is being added unconditionally in the [CMakeLists.txt](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/52a7eeb5cee7f060a7401a84739cd67aaec3f654/CMakeLists.txt?at=default#cl-72) for the amd64 platform only.

I believe that is safe to apply this patch, at least safe for the precise platform, and I believe that won't change anything in the amd64 platform anyway. We won't use cmake lower than 2.8.9 in new releases or releases that implies going downstream (debian, ubuntu of fedora), so we won't be affected by this limitation.

Regarding to change and stop generating static libraries and just add the object code to the shared library, definitely is an option (probably the most logical one), but I don't see many (or important) advantages over using a static file ... a part from solving this -fPIC problem automatically :)
content.html:
You are right, it was introduced in 2.8.9. However it is not failing on my precise machine (cmake 2.8.7).

What was weird to me is that -fPIC was present on the default precise compilation (even without this patch):

[100%] Building CXX object gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/CMakeFiles/gzqtpropertybrowser.dir/qrc_qtpropertybrowser.cxx.o
cd /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser && /usr/bin/c++   -DLIBBULLET_VERSION=2.82 -DQT_GUI_LIB -DQT_CORE_LIB -DQT_GUI_LIB -DQT_CORE_LIB -DQT_NO_DEBUG -DQT_NO_DEBUG -g -O2 -mfpmath=sse -msse -msse2  -Wall -Wextra -Wno-long-long -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wno-unused-value -Wfloat-equal -Wshadow -Winit-self -Wswitch-default -Wmissing-include-dirs -pedantic  -g -O2 -mfpmath=sse -msse -msse2  -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/test/gtest/include -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/deps -I/home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser -isystem /usr/include/OGRE/RTShaderSystem -isystem /usr/include/OGRE -isystem /usr/include/OGRE/Terrain -isystem /usr/include/OGRE/Paging -isystem /usr/local/include/sdformat-1.4 -I/usr/include/qt4 -I/usr/include/qt4/QtGui -I/usr/include/qt4/QtCore    -fPIC -o CMakeFiles/gzqtpropertybrowser.dir/qrc_qtpropertybrowser.cxx.o -c /home/jrivero/code/gazebo/build/gazebo/gui/qtpropertybrowser/qrc_qtpropertybrowser.cxx
Linking CXX static library libgzqtpropertybrowser.a

After some research, I found that it is being added unconditionally in the CMakeLists.txt for the amd64 platform only.

I believe that is safe to apply this patch, at least safe for the precise platform, and I believe that won't change anything in the amd64 platform anyway. We won't use cmake lower than 2.8.9 in new releases or releases that implies going downstream (debian, ubuntu of fedora), so we won't be affected by this limitation.

Regarding to change and stop generating static libraries and just add the object code to the shared library, definitely is an option (probably the most logical one), but I don't see many (or important) advantages over using a static file ... a part from solving this -fPIC problem automatically :)

pullrequest.title: Fixes to compile gazebo in the ARM platform

content.raw: OK great, if the property isn't causing problems in older versions of CMake then we're good to go.
content.html: OK great, if the property isn't causing problems in older versions of CMake then we're good to go.
